summary: Completed frontend testing for new Postnatal ASB topic and Children Metabolic Emergencies approach. Fixed CRITICAL BUG in MetabolicEmergencyApproach.jsx - incorrect Section component props causing runtime error. After fix, all 16 test cases PASSED.
passed_tests: 'Infant of Mother with ASB' topic appears in Postnatal dropdown
ASB topic content displays IDSA/AAP recommendations
ASB topic has 'NO routine screening' recommendations
ASB topic has Management algorithm (Well-Appearing Infant section)
ASB topic has Urine Collection section (Suprapubic aspiration)
Search 'bacteriuria' in Postnatal filters to show ASB topic
'Metabolic Emergencies' appears in Children Approaches dropdown
Metabolic Emergencies content displays IEM presentations
Metabolic Emergencies has lab findings table (MSUD, Organic Acidemias, Urea Cycle)
Metabolic Emergencies has Hyperammonemia EMERGENCY Management section
Metabolic Emergencies has Seizure Cofactor Trials section (Pyridoxine)
Search 'ammonia' in Children Approaches finds Metabolic Emergencies
Search 'metabolic' in Children Approaches finds Metabolic Emergencies
GIR calculations appear when weight is entered (48.0 - 60.0 mL/hr for 10kg)
Insulin and Carnitine calculations appear with weight
critical_code_review_comments: FIXED: MetabolicEmergencyApproach.jsx was using incorrect props (isOpen, onToggle) instead of (id, expandedSections, toggleSection) for Section component - caused runtime TypeError
Both new components now follow the correct Section component API pattern used by other approaches
AsymptomaticBacteriuriaApproach.jsx: Well-structured with proper data-testid attribute
MetabolicEmergencyApproach.jsx: Now correctly uses Section component with id, expandedSections, toggleSection props
Search keywords properly configured for both new topics

success_rate.frontend: 100% - All 16 tests passed after bug fix

context_for_next_testing_agent: Two new topics added and tested: 1) 'Infant of Mother with ASB' in Postnatal section (NICU > Postnatal) - based on AAP/IDSA guidelines, 2) 'Metabolic Emergencies' in Children Approaches (Children > Approaches) - IEM approach with GIR calculations. Navigation: /nicu/postnatal for ASB, /children/approaches for Metabolic Emergencies. All data-testid attributes present: postnatal-tab-bacteriuria, asymptomatic-bacteriuria-approach, tab-metabolic, metabolic-emergency-approach. GIR calculation shows in Hypoglycemia section when weight is entered.
